page.title: 03Farming in the Hunshelf area
page.content: This area is predominantly farmland and includes mainly pastureland for dairy farming,and some arable.The main livestock kept are Friesian cows, others include sheep,horses,pigs and goats.A farm could own up to 150 cows,and one bull. The major crop is grass for the livestock,but some cereals and root vegetables are also grown. The fields,separated by dry-stone walls,have an average size of around 5 acres,but could be as large as 12 acres. The people who work on the farms are generally the owner and his family.The produce(eg eggs,milk,beef,cereal crops) is sold to the Milk Marketing Board,at market,or to passers-by attracted by roadside signs.
